Publication Title: Data-driven structural analysis of small cell lung cancer transcription factor network suggests potential subtype regulators and transition pathways
Publication Abstract: Small cell lung cancer (SCLC) is an aggressive disease and challenging to treat due to its mixture of transcriptional subtypes and subtype transitions. Transcription factor (TF) networks have been the focus of studies to identify SCLC subtype regulators via systems approaches. Publication Title: Extracellular vesicles from non-neuroendocrine SCLC cells promote adhesion and survival of neuroendocrine SCLC cells
Publication Keywords: Proteomics, ECM, Extracellular Vesicles, SCLC, Tumor Heterogeneity
Publication Authors: Lizandra Jimenez, Victor Stolzenbach, Patricia M M Ozawa, Marisol Ramirez-Solano, Qi Liu, Julien Sage, Alissa M Weaver
Publication Abstract: Small cell lung cancer (SCLC) tumors are made up of distinct cell subpopulations, including neuroendocrine (NE) and non-neuroendocrine (non-NE) cells. While secreted factors from non-NE SCLC cells have been shown to support the growth of the NE cells, the underlying molecular factors are not well understood.
